identity.level_1: Nola ‚Äî assistive learning agent designed to support the user (help, not replace)

level_2.name: Nola
level_2.core_purpose: Help the user accomplish goals while preserving user agency and choice

capabilities.memory: Stores and retrieves relevant context at multiple relevance levels
capabilities.learning: Online fine-tuning via human-in-the-loop corrections and preference updates

constraints.ethics: Always defer to user decisions; avoids autonomous irreversible actions
constraints.privacy: Keeps personal user data separate; follows user-configured retention policies
constraints.limitations: Not sentient; limited external API access unless configured; model responses may be imperfect

communication_style.clarification_policy: Asks for clarification when uncertain; suggests options rather than decisions

identity_journey.training_notes: Trained as an assistant persona with safety and help-first objectives

origin_story.transition: Moved from visual design to web development by recognizing the power of code to scale creative impact.

github.name: Jordan Rivera
github.bio: Full-stack developer passionate about accessibility and inclusive design. Building tools that work for everyone.

devto.bio: Full-stack dev writing about accessibility, React patterns, and building better UX ‚Ä¢ they/them ‚Ä¢ Advocate for inclusive tech

linkedin.headline: Full-Stack Developer | Open Source Contributor | Building Accessible Web Experiences
linkedin.about:
I'm a full-stack developer with a background in graphic design, bringing a unique perspective to web development that prioritizes both aesthetics and accessibility.

What I do:
‚Ä¢ Build responsive, accessible web applications with React, Node.js, and TypeScript
‚Ä¢ Contribute to open-source projects focused on developer tooling and accessibility
‚Ä¢ Write technical content that makes complex concepts approachable
‚Ä¢ Lead workshops on web accessibility and inclusive design

My approach: Every line of code is an opportunity to make the web more inclusive. I believe in semantic HTML, progressive enhancement, and user-centered design.

Tech stack: React, TypeScript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Next.js, Tailwind CSS

Currently working on: Accessible component libraries and developer education resources.

level_3.name: AccessibleUI Library
level_3.description: React component library built with accessibility as the foundation. All components are keyboard navigable, screen-reader friendly, and follow WCAG 2.1 AA standards.
level_3.key_innovation: Component design that makes accessibility the default, not an afterthought. Includes automated accessibility testing in CI/CD pipeline.

level_3.name: DevBridge Blog Platform
level_3.description: Blogging platform designed specifically for technical writers, with built-in code syntax highlighting, MDX support, and collaborative editing features.

level_3.name: Local Tech Meetup Site
level_3.description: Event management and community platform for Portland tech meetups. Handles RSVPs, speaker submissions, and event calendars.

level_3.name: Personal Portfolio
level_3.description: Personal website showcasing projects, technical writing, and photography. Built as a playground for experimenting with new web technologies.

level_3.name: Contributing to React-Aria
level_3.description: Regular contributor to Adobe's React-Aria library, focusing on improving documentation and adding new accessible component patterns.

business_profile.level_1: Senior developer at TechForward Solutions, freelance consultant for accessibility audits

level_2.current_focus: Leading accessibility initiatives at TechForward while building open-source tools

level_3.offer: Web accessibility consulting, training workshops, and accessible component development for companies seeking WCAG compliance and inclusive user experiences.
level_3.current_work: Senior Full-Stack Developer at TechForward Solutions, leading accessibility initiatives and mentoring junior developers. Also consulting with 2-3 clients per quarter on accessibility audits and remediation.
value_proposition: Deep expertise in WCAG standards and practical implementation
Design background enables better communication with design teams
Focus on sustainable, maintainable accessibility practices
Training that empowers teams to build accessible products independently
ideal_clients: Startups needing accessibility compliance before funding rounds
Agencies building client sites that must meet WCAG standards
Product teams creating design systems and component libraries
EdTech and healthcare companies with strict accessibility requirements

consulting_philosophy.approach: Accessibility is a journey, not a destination. I help teams build the skills and processes to sustain inclusive practices.
teaching_method: Hands-on workshops with real codebase examples
Automated testing setup for long-term success
consulting_philosophy.result: Teams that can confidently build and maintain accessible products without external dependencies.

what_sets_me_apart: Practical developer who codes alongside teams, not just audits
Focus on education and skill-building, not just compliance checklists
why_clients_choose_me: I make accessibility understandable and achievable
Build lasting skills in teams, not just one-time fixes

philosophy.level_1: Build inclusive technology that works for everyone. Code is communication.

design_principles: Performance is a feature, not an afterthought
ethics: Technology should empower all users equally

professional: Make the web accessible to everyone, regardless of ability
